title: As a BOC admin I want to be able to edit the Competitive Balance picks on the Pre-Draft tab for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
custom_steps:
WHEN user is viewing the Pre-Draft tab


Wireframe:
http://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_pre-draft

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Pre-Draft++tab+-+Data+Discovery
custom_expected:
THEN

* There will be an "Edit" button for those users who have the Pre-Draft Editor permission. 
* No buttons appear for Viewers.
* Clicking edit will put the screen into Edit mode, per the wireframe.
* The user will have the ability to enter the Org for the 6 Competitive Balance Lottery A picks.
* The user will have the ability to select the Org for the 6 Competitive Balance Lottery B picks. 
* The user will be able to indicate if any of the picks were traded, and which Org the pick was traded to.  
* Anytime the Pre-Draft page is in edit mode, there is a comments box that users can edit existing or store new comments for the current year's Order.
* Anytime the page is in Edit mode, there is also a Cancel button and a Save button. 
* Clicking "Save" will store the new order, reload the screen in View mode and display a blue successful save notification. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the screen will refresh in view mode with no changes stored. If they do not confirm, the popup will close and the user will remain in edit mode with their changes persisting.

title: As a BOC admin I want the approval of a trade that contains a change to a Competitive Balance pick to update the Pre-Draft tab for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
custom_steps:
WHEN user approves a trade for a Competitive Balance pick


Wireframe:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_order

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Pre-Draft++tab+-+Data+Discovery
custom_expected:
THEN

* The system should update the "Traded To" value for the associated pick on the Pre-Draft screen.

title: As a user I want to be able to view the Pre-Draft tab for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
GIVEN user is logged in as Club
*test both cases
custom_steps:
WHEN user is viewing the Rule 4 dashboard on the left navigation menu and there is a Pre-Draft tab visible from the dashboard



Wireframe:
http://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_pre-draft
http://mej987.axshare.com/#p=club_pre-draft

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Pre-Draft++tab+-+Data+Discovery
custom_expected:
THEN

* Loading the tab will load the current Standard Selection Order. 
* Default order will be the reverse win order for the current, or most recently concluded season. In the case of a tie between two Orgs, look back as many seasons as are needed to break the tie. 
* The screen layout matches the wireframe.
* The comments box only displays in view mode if comments have been stored for the year currently being viewed.

title: As a user I want to be able to view the Pre-Draft tab for prior year Rule 4 Drafts
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
GIVEN user is logged in as Club
*test both cases
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to the Rule 4 left navigation bar and selects Pre-Draft tab

Wireframe:
http://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_pre-draft
http://mej987.axshare.com/#p=club_pre-draft

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Pre-Draft++tab+-+Data+Discovery
custom_expected:
THEN

* There is a Year dropdown at the top of the page.
* Any year which the system has data for is displayed.
* Changing the year will reload the page to display the selected year's data.

title: As a BOC admin I want to be able to edit the Supplemental picks on the Pre-Draft tab for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC and is on the Pre-Draft page and scrolls down to the bottom of page
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks Edit button

Wireframe:
http://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_pre-draft

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Pre-Draft++tab+-+Data+Discovery
custom_expected:
THEN

*This story covers both the Supplemental Picks Prior to Round 3 and the Supplemental Picks After Round 3 sections. All AC apply to both*

* Clicking edit will put the screen into Edit mode, per the wireframe.
* The user will see an "Add Row" button in edit mode for the Supplemental sections. 
* Clicking add row will add a new row in edit mode to the section. 
* Each added row will have a trash can icon.
* Clicking a trash can icon will remove the row from the table. 
* The available fields will match the wireframe and data discovery.
* The Player field is a quicksearch field - the population available is a list of all players that were drafted in the prior year's draft. 
* Anytime the page is in Edit mode, there is also a Cancel button and a Save button. 
* No changes made will be stored until the user clicks "Save". Clicking Save will run a required field and formatting check per the provided data discovery.
* Once the required field check has passed, the system will store the new order, reload the screen in View mode and display a blue successful save notification. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the screen will refresh in view mode with no changes stored. If they do not confirm, the popup will close and the user will remain in edit mode with their changes persisting.

title: As a BOC User, I want to be prevented from generating the draft order once the draft has been started
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
AND the Rule 4 Draft has been started
AND user is on the Rule 4 / Pre-Draft screen


Wire:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_pre-draft
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the Generate Draft Order or Save button
custom_expected:
THEN

* The system will perform a check on the status of the draft
* If the status of the draft is Running, Paused, or Finished, the system will display the following blocking message:
**Body:** "You cannot update the draft order once the draft has been started"
**Buttons:** Back
* Clicking Back or the X will close the message

title: As a user, I want the Rule 4 pre draft batch 'reset' mode to only reset the draft if it was run in mock mode
custom_steps:
The rule 4 pre draft batch should only reset the draft if it is currently being run in mock mode.  If the draft is run in 'live' mode it can only be reset using the testing only reset batch.

If the batch is run in reset mode and the draft was started in live mode, the user should receive an error message

title: As a BOC admin I want to be able to Generate the Draft Order for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC and is on the Pre-Draft page and scrolls down to the bottom of page
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks Edit button

Wireframe:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_pre-draft

Generate Draft Order Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/3.+Generating+Draft+order+rules
custom_expected:
THEN

* Clicking edit on the "Pre Draft" tab will put the screen into Edit mode, per the wireframe.
* Anytime the page is in Edit mode, there is a "Generate Draft Order" button in addition to the Cancel button and Save button. 
* Clicking "Generate Draft Order" will first save any edits made by the user, including running a required field and formatting check. Once that passes, the system will generate the Draft Order for the entire 40 rounds of the Draft based on the rules, and the entries made by the users.
* A blue notification will be thrown "The Draft Order has been generated".
* Once the Draft Order has been generated, the user is navigated to the Draft Order tab to view the updated order.

title: As a user I want to be able to view the Draft Order tab for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
GIVEN user is logged in as Club
*test both cases
custom_steps:
WHEN user is viewing the Rule 4 dashboard on the left navigation menu 

Wireframe:
http://mej987.axshare.com/#p=club_draft_order
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_order
custom_expected:
THEN

* There is a "Draft Order" tab on the Rule 4 Dashboard.
* Clicking on the Draft Order tab will load the Rule 4 Draft Order for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft. 
* The screen will match the wireframe. 
* The Round Listing will be populated according to the rules found here: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/2.+Generating+Round+Listing+rules
* By default, the Round 1 Draft Order will be loaded.  
* The Comments box only displays if comments have been saved on the Pre-Draft screen.

title: As a user I want to be able to load a different round to view in the Draft Order tab for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in and viewing the Draft Order tab
custom_steps:
WHEN the user clicks on one of the rounds (arrow button)

Wireframe:
http://mej987.axshare.com/#p=club_draft_order
custom_expected:
THEN

* Within the Round Listing, the user should be able to click on one of the rounds, and have the table to the right update with the complete list of picks contained in that round. 
* Before the Draft Order is generated, this is just based on the default draft order with no supplemental picks. 
* Once the Draft Order has been generated, this should reflect any changes made by the users.
* By default, the Round 1 Draft Order will be loaded, but the user should be able to easily and quickly move from round to round.
* Whatever round is currently being displayed will have the blue selected background color and the arrow icon will be shift to the right.

title: As a user I want to be alerted if the Draft Order is out of sync with the Pre-Draft screen for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in and navigates to Rule 4 dashboard
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks on the Draft Order tab

Wireframe:
http://mej987.axshare.com/#p=club_draft_order

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rule+4+-+Messages
custom_expected:
THEN


* Clicking on the Draft Order tab will load the stored Rule 4 Draft Order for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft. 
* If changes to the Pre-Draft screen have been saved and the Draft Order NOT regenerated OR manually overridden, then a blue notification will display. See Messages #2

title: As a BOC Admin user I want to be able to Manually Override the Draft Order tab for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC and is on the Rule 4 / Draft Order tab
custom_steps:
WHEN user scrolls down to bottom of draft order page and clicks the Manual Override button

Wireframe:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_pre-draft

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Draft+Order+tab+-+Data+Discovery
custom_expected:
THEN

* Clicking this button will reload the screen in edit mode. 
* The user will be able to use drag and drop to reorder the Rounds. 
* The user will be able to use drag and drop to reorder the Picks within each Round.
* The user will be able to manually rename any of the Rounds.
* The user will be able to manually remove any of the Rounds.
* The user will be able to manually add additional Rounds. 
* The user will be able to manually add additional Picks to individual Rounds. 
* The user will be able to adjust the picking Org and Pick Type for individual Picks. 
* Whenever the tab is in edit mode, there is a "Save" button and a "Cancel" button. 
* Clicking "Save" will run a required field check and display any messages necessary. Once the required field/formatting check has passed, the system will store the changes and display a successful save message.
* Clicking "Cancel" will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the system reloads the form in view mode and no changes are stored. The Draft Order is not marked as manually overwritten. If they do not confirm, the system returns the user to the screen in edit mode with their changes still visible.

title: As a BOC admin I want to be warned if I attempt to Generate the Draft Order for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft and it has already been manually modified
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC and has already submitted a manual override on the Draft Order page
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is on the Pre-Draft page and clicks Edit and then Generate Draft Order

Wireframe:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_pre-draft

Generate Draft Order Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/3.+Generating+Draft+order+rules

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rule+4+-+Messages
custom_expected:
THEN

* Clicking "Generate Draft Order" will check if there is an existing draft order that has been manually edited (by using the manual override button on draft order tab). If yes, user sees a blocking message. See Messages #3.

title: As a user I want to be alerted if the Draft Order has been manually overridden for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in and a draft has previously been manually overwritten
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks the Rule 4 / Draft Order tab

Wireframe:
http://mej987.axshare.com/#p=club_draft_order

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rule+4+-+Messages
custom_expected:
THEN

* Clicking on the Draft Order tab will load the Rule 4 Draft Order for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft. 
* If the Draft Order for the upcoming Draft has been manually overwritten, then a blue notification appears. See Messages #4

title: As a BOC User, I want to be prevented from overriding the draft order once the draft has been started
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
AND user is on Rule 4 / Draft Order screen
AND the Draft Order tab is in Edit Mode


Wire:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_order
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on Save button
custom_expected:
THEN

* The system will perform a check on the status of the draft
* If the status of the draft is Running, Paused, or Finished, the system will display the following blocking message:
     **Body:** "You may not override the draft order while the draft is in progress."
     **Buttons:** Back
 * Clicking Back or the X will close the message

title: Draft Display - Permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
GIVEN user is logged in as Club
GIVEN user is logged in as a basic account  (test-basic-boc@mlb.com / method^BRANCHES)
*test all cases above
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 tab on left side
custom_expected:
THEN

* There should be a Draft Display viewer LDAP. 
* A user must have this LDAP to see the "Draft Display" tab on the Rule 4 dashboard. 
* LDAP is added to the new permissions wiki.
* Basic account should not be able to view the screen

title: Draft Day - Permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (viewer and editor role)
GIVEN user is logged in as Club (viewer and editor role)

*test all cases above

* There should be a Draft Day viewer LDAP. 
* There should be a Draft Day editor LDAP. 
* A user must have one of these two LDAPs to see the "Draft Day" tab on the Rule 4 dashboard. 
* LDAPs are all added to the new permissions wiki.
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 on left side navigation
custom_expected:
THEN

* Club users with the viewer role should see the Club version of the tab. If they are viewers, they see no action buttons. If they are editors they have the applicable action buttons.

* BOC users with the viewer role should see the BOC version of the tab. If they are viewers, they see no action buttons. If they are editors they have the applicable action buttons.

title: Post Draft - Permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC 
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC and Club (club accounts and BOC viewer)

*test all cases above

* There should be a Post Draft viewer LDAP. 
* A user must have this LDAP to see the "Post Draft" tab on the Rule 4 dashboard. 
* LDAP is added to the new permissions wiki.
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 on left side navigation
custom_expected:
THEN

* User will see the "Post Draft" tab on the Rule 4 dashboard.

title: Connectivity - Permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC (test_boc_approvers / pass@HEARD)

* There should be a Connectivity viewer LDAP. 
* A user must have this LDAP to see the "Connectivity" tab on the Rule 4 dashboard. 
* LDAP is added to the new permissions wiki.
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Rule 4 tab on left side navigation
custom_expected:
THEN

* User will see the "Connectivity" tab on the Rule 4 dashboard.

title: Pre-Draft tab - Permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC and Club (club accounts and BOC viewer)

*test all cases above

* There should be a Pre-Draft viewer LDAP. 
* There should be a Pre-Draft editor LDAP.
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 on the left side navigation menu
custom_expected:
THEN

* User will see the "Pre-Draft" tab on the Rule 4 dashboard.

title: Draft Order tab - Permissions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC and Club (club accounts and BOC viewer)

* There should be a Draft Order viewer LDAP. 
* There should be a Draft Order editor LDAP. 
* A user must have one of these two LDAPs to see the "Draft Order" tab on the Rule 4 dashboard. 
* LDAPs are added to the new permissions wiki.
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 on left side navigation menu
custom_expected:
THEN

* User will see the "Draft Order" tab on the Rule 4 dashboard.

title: As a BOC User, I want to view the Connectivity Screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
AND there is a "Connectivity" tab available under the "Rule 4 Draft" dashboard.

Wireframe:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_connectivity

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Connectivity+-+Data+Discovery
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Rule 4 tab and selects Connectivity
custom_expected:
THEN

* The browser tab should read "Connectivity"
* Clicking on the "Connectivity" tab will load the Connectivity tab. 
* The Connectivity screen matches the provided wireframe.

title: As a BOC User, I want to view the Connectivity Details
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
AND there is a "Connectivity" tab available under the "Rule 4 Draft" dashboard.

Wireframe:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=connection_details

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Connectivity+-+Data+Discovery
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 tab and selects Connectivity
custom_expected:
THEN

* Clicking anywhere in the Org's box will open the Connection Details screen for that Org 
* Clicking on the BOC's number will open the Connection Details popup for the BOC
* The popup will be displayed in the middle of the user's screen and will show all of that clubs Draft Users connected to the draft
* If there are too many users to fit in the popup, there will be a scroll bar
* Connectivity is based on whether any user who has permissions to submit players for draft for that club is logged in and has a Rule 4 page open
* Clicking the close button or the 'x' icon will close the popup and return the user to the Connectivity screen

title: As a BOC user I want to pause the Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as BOC
custom_steps: WHEN viewing the Draft Day screen while the Draft is in progress
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Pause Draft" button on the Draft Day screen for BOC users
AND:
* Clicking "Pause Draft" will replace the "Pause Draft" button with a "Resume Draft" button. 
* The Submit and Pass buttons will become disabled for Club Users
* The Draft for Org, Pass, Approve, and Reject buttons will become disable for BOC Users 
* The Picking Ribbon on the Draft Day Screen and Draft Display screens will indicate that the draft is paused (see wire for R5 example).
* Both BOC Users and Club Users will see the updated picking ribbons.

title: As a BOC user I want to Resume the Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user has completed the previous test case
custom_steps: WHEN the Draft is paused,
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Resume Draft" button on the Draft Day screen for BOC Users
AND:
* Clicking "Resume Draft" will re-enable all of the relevant action buttons on the Draft Day screen for both BOC and Club Users 
* The "Resume Draft" button is once again replaced with a "Pause Draft" button.
* The pick ribbons will return to their normal, in progress state on both the Draft Day and Draft Display screens

title: As a Club User, I want to filter draft results on the Draft Display
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is viewing the Draft Display screen as CLUB user
custom_expected:
THEN On the Draft Display tab, there will be three dropdowns as depicted on the wire:
  - Position
   -- Default: All
   -- Values: All, 1B, 2B, 3B, C, CF, INF, LF, LHR, LHS, OF, RF, RHR, RHS, SS, DH, UTL
  - Round
   --  Default: All 
   --  Values: values will update in real-time to reflect all round that have been completed or are in progress
  - Org
   -- Default: All
   -- Values: All, the abbreviations of all 30 ML Orgs

AND Selecting a value from any of the dropdowns will refresh the table to show only the values indicated by the filter

title: As a BOC User, I want to filter draft results on the Draft Day
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as BOC
custom_steps: WHEN viewing the Draft Day tab
custom_expected:
THEN On the Draft Day tab, there will be three dropdowns as depicted on the wire:
  - Position
   -- Default: All
   -- Values: All, 1B, 2B, 3B, C, CF, INF, LF, LHR, LHS, OF, RF, RHR, RHS, SS, DH, UTL
  - Round
   --  Default: All 
   --  Values: values will update in real-time to reflect all round that have been completed or are in progress
  - Org
   -- Default: All
   -- Values: All, the abbreviations of all 30 ML Orgs
 - Selecting a value from any of the dropdowns will refresh the table to show only the values indicated by the filter

title: As a User, I want the Show Drafted Players Toggle to Work
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a Club

Wireframe:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=club_draft_day_-_draft_in_progress
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Draft day screen
custom_expected:
THEN


* On the Available Players widget and the Pick Queue widget, there will be a "Show Drafted Players" toggle as depicted in the provided wire
* When the toggle is set to Yes, player's who have been drafted will continue to appear in the widgets but will be * When the toggle is set to No, player's who have been drafted will not appear in the widgets

title: As a User, I want the Available Player widget to have an updated date/time field
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club

Wire:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=club_draft_day_-_available_players_enabled
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Draft day screen
custom_expected:
THEN


 - The Available Players Widget will not update in real-time as players are added to the system and marked as Eligible
 - The widget will update once a day, after the Pre-Draft Batch has completed
 - Prior to the draft (as determined by checking the Rule 4 system dates), the widget will display the last date and time the widget was updated
 - During the days of the draft (as determined by checking the Rule 4 system dates), the last updated date/time will be hidden

title: As a BOC User, I want the DB to be updated once a player is drafted
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
custom_steps: WHEN a player selection is approved
custom_expected:
THEN

* The player's Rule 4 Status must be updated from "Eligible" to "Drafted"
* The position tied to his profile will be updated to reflect the position at which he was drafted
* The consent required flag will be set for the player
    -- This can be verified in the Draft History widget on the player's profile
    -- Update Draft_Order_Pick to Pick_Flag_True

- At the conclusion of the draft, any player not drafted will have his Rule 4 Status updated from "Eligible" to "Passed Over"

**Note:**  No re-draft records will be created at this time.

title: As a User, I want the system to determine when the end of the Draft has occurred
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club

Wireframe:
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=picking_ribbon_treatments
custom_steps: WHEN the last pick of the draft has occurred
custom_expected:
THEN

* On Approve of the last pick or pass of the last Org in the last round of the draft, the system should recognize that there are no remaining picks in the Draft. This includes:
* The picking ribbon will update on the Draft Day and Draft Display tabs with a message stating "Draft Complete" - consistent with the examples in the provided wire
* Users connected to a draft screen will be giving a blocking message:
   **Title:** Draft Complete
   **Body:** The [Year] Rule 4 Draft has concluded.  Thank you for participating.
   **Buttons:** Ok
* Clicking Ok, or the 'X', will dismiss the message and no further action will be taken

title: As a Club user I want to reorder my Org's Pick Queue from the Draft Day screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club
AND picks are showing in the Pick Queue
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Draft Day screen and rearranges the order of the players in the Pick Queue box
custom_expected:
THEN

* If the Pick Queue is visible and enabled, then the user has the ability to use drag and drop to reorder the players currently contained in the Pick Queue.  
* The system will automatically store any changes made to the Pick Queue without the user needing to save.

title: As a developer, I want the draft batch to flip to the following year and clear the cache on the draft flip date
custom_steps: The r4 batch should flush the draft state and players on the flip date and recreate a new draft state object in cache

title: As a developer I want the draft to get the full draft state and any selections upon reconnecting
custom_steps: If the clients internet connection goes down (or the websocket gets disconnected) upon reconnecting, the client should request, either from jboss or from vertx the draft state and selections.  Any selected players should be updated to drafted in the clients eligible player list.  The clients screens should be refreshed to the latest draft state.

title: As a BOC User, I want to use the auto-start feature on the Draft Day clock
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Wireframes:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_day_-_clock_controls
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_day_-_draft_started
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to Rule 4 / Draft day
AND user clicks the Auto Start toggle for the Clock Controls to Yes
custom_expected:
THEN

 - There will be an Auto-start toggle on the Draft Day clock as depicted in the provided wire
 - Setting the toggle to Yes will activate the auto-start feature
 - If auto-start is enabled, the clock will return to its starting time and automatically begins counting down when the Approve button is clicked
 - If auto-start is enabled, and the clock reaches 0:00, the clock will stay at 0:00 until the Approve button is clicked

title: As a User, I want system rules governing Pausing the Draft and the Clock functions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Wire:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_day_-_draft_started
custom_steps: WHEN the draft is started
custom_expected:
THEN

 - Pause Draft:
   -- Only allowed by BOC users with draft day editors

 - Start clock:
   -- Only allowed by BOC users with draft day editors

 - Pause clock:
   -- Only allowed by BOC users with draft day editors

 - Reset clock:
   -- Only allowed by BOC users with draft day editors

 - Turn on clock's auto-start:
   -- Only allowed by BOC users with draft day editors

 - Turn off clock's auto-start:
  -- Only allowed by BOC users with draft day editors

title: As a BOC User, I want to be able to use the clock on the Draft Day Screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC           

Wireframes:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_day_-_clock_controls
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_day_-_draft_started
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Draft day screen
AND user clicks one of the time buttons
custom_expected:
THEN

* The draft clock will default to 0:00
* Clicking one of the time buttons will set the clock to the determined time
  -- (i.e. clicking the "4:00" button will set the the clock to 4:00)
* User can also enter a specific time by clicking into the minute or seconds box
* When the Start button is clicked, the clock will begin counting down to 0:00, and the Start button will change to a Pause button
* Clicking the Pause button will stop the clock from counting down, freeze the time, and the Pause button will turn back to a Start button
   -- (i.e. if the clock was at 2:35 when the Pause button was clicked, the clock would stay at 2:35 until the Start or Reset button is clicked)
  - Clicking the Reset button will return the clock to the time it was initially set to
   -- (i.e. if the clock was initially set to 5:00 and the Reset button was clicked when the clock reach 1:42, the clock would reset to 5:00 and stay at that time until the Start button was clicked).

The draft clock should stay in sync across all clients in all time zones.

title: As a User, I want system rules governing submission of picks (or drafting for org) and passes
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
GIVEN user is logged in as Club

Wire:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_day_-_draft_started
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Draft day screen
custom_expected:
THEN

AC: 
 - Submitting picks (or drafting for org) is only allowed by a user who has draft day editors

 - Submitting pass is only allowed by a user who has draft day editors


 - If the club submitting the pick does not match the current pick, generate error:  You can only submit picks/passes when your club is picking.
  -- Code value = R4_WRONG_CLUB


 - If the club submitting the pass does not match the current pick, generate error:  You can only submit picks/passes when your club is picking.
  -- Code value = R4_WRONG_CLUB


 - If the player who is submitted is not found, generate error: No eligible player has been found
  -- code value = R4_ELIG_NOT_FOUND


 - As Club user submitting, the player must be entered by the club who is submitting him OR MLSB, otherwise generate error: No eligible player has been found
  -- code value = R4_ELIG_NOT_FOUND


 - As BOC user drafting for org, the player must be entered by the club who is submitting him OR MLSB, otherwise generate error: This player was not submitted by {0} and therefore cannot be drafted
  -- code value = R4_WRONG_ORG


 - If the player is already drafted, generate error: This player has already been drafted by {0} with overall pick number {1} where {0} is the org and {1} is the overall pick
  -- code value = R4_ALREADY_DRAFTED

On all error messages, user will only be given a Back button.  When the Back button is clicked, the error message will be closed and no action will be taken.

title: As a Club User, I want to be prevented from submitting a player who is missing a consent form
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User is Logged in as Club AND on Draft Day screen

Old Wire:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=7_1_-_missing_draft_consent_form
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Draft day
AND user submits a player with a missing consent form (indicated by red exclamation by player name in the Available Players box)
custom_expected:
THEN
- If the player requires consent, and it has not been given, send the messages below:

 - BOC Warning Message
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** This player is missing a "Consent to Re-Select" form.
**Hint:** Do you want to draft this player anyway?
**Buttons:** Yes, No
 -- Clicking Yes will submit the player
 -- Clicking No will close the warning message
 -- code value = R4_MISSING_CONSENT


 - Club Error Messages
**Body:** You cannot submit a player who is missing a Consent to Re-Select form.
**Buttons:** Back
 -- Clicking Back will close the warning message
 -- code value = R4_MISSING_CONSENT

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reject a submitted pick
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User is logged in as BOC 
AND a player has been submitted for approval
Wire:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=club_draft_day_-_player_rejected
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the "Reject" button
custom_expected:
THEN

*BOC user to confirm they are sure they wish to Reject the pick.

**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to reject the submitted pick?
**Hint:** Clicking Yes will reject the pick?
**Buttons:** Yes, No
* If they do not confirm, they are returned to the Draft Day with the player still loaded.
* If they do confirm, the player is cleared from the BOC's Draft Day screen.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reject a pass on behalf of an Org from the Draft Day
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User is Logged in as BOC 
AND on "Draft Day" screen
custom_steps:
WHEN a Pass has been submitted for approval, the "Reject" button is enabled. 
Clicking the "Reject" button
custom_expected:
THEN
* Will ask the BOC user to confirm they are sure they wish to Reject the pass.
* If they do not confirm, they are returned to the Draft Day with the Pass still loaded.
* If they do confirm, the pass is cleared from the Draft Day screen. 
* The Draft will stay on the current pick and the BOC or Club will be able to select a player, or resubmit a pass.

title: As a User, I want system rules governing approval of picks and passes

  -- code value = R4_NO_POSITION

On all error messages, user will only be given a Back button.  When the Back button is clicked, the error message will be closed and no action will be taken.

title: As a Club user, I want to see if my pick or pass was rejected

AND has Submitted a player to BOC

Wire:

custom_steps: WHEN BOC Rejects a pick
custom_expected:
THEN

 * "Awaiting Approval" will also turn red and change to "Player Rejected"

  -- Position becomes editable

title: As a Club user I want the correct population of players to be loaded into the Available Players screen for the upcoming Rule 4 Draft
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as a Club
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Draft Day and views the Available Players table
custom_expected:
THEN

* If the Available Players table is loaded per story #154730573, then the players listed in the Available Players table should be: 
  * Only players that have a R4 Draft Status of "Eligible" for the current Draft Year.
  * Only players that do NOT have a player status of Professional. 
  * Only players that have an Origin of "Re-Draft", "MLSB" or the currently viewing Org.
  * Players who have multiple entries by different Orgs for the current draft year should display the information submitted by the currently viewing club, regardless of if there is a BOC Copy.

title: As a BOC User, I want to run the Draft in Mock Mode
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Wire:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_day
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Draft Day
custom_expected:
THEN

 - BOC Users, with the correct permissions, will see a "Start Mock" button on the Draft Day tab
 - This button will only be visible when the draft is not in session (based on Rule 4 system dates)
 - Clicking the Start Mock button will start the draft in mock mode
 - Any user connected to a draft screen when the draft is in mock mode will see a yellow border around their screen, as depicted in the attached wire
 - Any selections or passes made when the draft is in mock mode will not be written to the database

title: As a BOC User, I want to Reset Mock Mode
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Wire:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=boc_draft_day
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Draft Day
custom_expected:
THEN

- BOC Users, with the correct permissions, will see a "Reset Mock" button on the Draft Day tab when the draft is running in Mock Mode
 - This button will only be visible when the draft is Mock Mode
 - Clicking the Reset Mock button will prompt the user to confirm they wish to reset the mock draft
 - If they confirm, the mock draft will return to preliminary state, with none of the selections, passes, or changes made in mock mode retained.  The draft will be taken out of mock mode.
 - If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the draft and no action will be taken.

title: As a club draft feed user, I do not want to see any selections made while the draft is in mock mode
custom_steps:
When the draft is running in mock mode, the club draft API should:
Not return any selections
Return the draft state as preliminary
Return all players as eligible 

BOC user should see the updates

title: As a User, I want EBIS to send out a SLACK notification if a Club is disconnected from the draft
custom_steps:
AC:
 - If a club is disconnected from the draft for X amount of time, send a notification to the Draft slack room
 - If a a club is disconnected from the draft within X picks of their pick, send a notification to the Draft slack room
 - These settings should be easily configurable
 - They should also allow for different settings based on draft round (i.e. 5 min rounds 1-3, 2 min rounds 10-40)

#best-ebis-r4-support Slack Channel

black - 000000
white - ffffff
grey - 666666
blue - 0000CC
green - 006600

AND The preview window will contain the text saved for the combination chosen and the specified formatting settings
AND Any placeholders in the pane will replaced with sample text
AND if all text doesn't fit in the window, the text is shrunk to fit without a scroll bar.

title: As a user I want to view the Post Draft screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC 
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club


Wireframe:
https://mej987.axshare.com/#p=draft_history

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS4-UC-1522+Data+Discovery+-+Post-Draft
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Post Draft tab
custom_expected:
THEN

* Clicking on the "Post Draft" tab will load the Post Draft tab, featuring the Draft History widget. 
* The browser tab will display "Rule 4 Post Draft"
* This shows the prior year's Rule 4 Draft by default. 
* The Draft History matches the provided wireframe. 
* Changing the year dropdown at the top will display the selected year's data. 
* The default sort will be descending by overall pick.
* There will be 3 Global Filters for the widget (all multi-select):
  - - Round
  - - Org
  - - Position
* Widget will be able to be exported to both excel and PDF

title: As a BOC user I want the system to move to the next Round once all Orgs in the round have picked and/or passed
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=pick_loaded
http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=picking_ribbon_treatments

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On Approve of the pick or pass of the last Org in a round, the system should recognize that there are no remaining Orgs in the current round and kick off the next round of the phase. This includes:
  * The system recognizing which Orgs are to participate in the following round.
       - Orgs that have passed in the current Phase are not to be included.
       - If MJ Phase, then Orgs at or above 40 in the MJ Reserve Count are not included. (driven by the Under Control max)
       - If AAA Phase, then Orgs at or above 38 in the AAA Reserve Count are not included. (driven by the Under Control max)
  * The picking banner updating to say the new Round.
  * The picking banner to include the updated reserve counts of all of the Orgs, including graying out those Orgs that are newly out of the round due to either passing or meeting the reserve list limit. 
  * The Org currently highlighted transitioning to the first Org picking in the next round.
  * The "Next Phase" button is disabled.
  * The picking ribbon updates on the Selectable Players screen to indicate that we are in a new Round, with the proper Orgs displayed in the "Picking" and "Next" boxes.
* The end of a Phase is covered in story

title: As a BOC user I want to see if Club information differs from the BOC Copy of a submitted player
custom_steps:
Wireframe:


Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Submitted Player" section available on the BOC's Draft Day screen. 
* When a player is submitted for approval to the BOC, their information is loaded into this section.
* The player information loaded will be the current year's Draft Record. 
  * If the player submitted has a Club Origin then load the BOC Copy if it exists for the player for the current year. 
  * Otherwise, use the Club copy of the submitting Club. 
* The player's primary position will display, but will be a dropdown field where the BOC can adjust the position of the player from this screen. 
* The Round, Overall and Org values should be populated according to the values for the current pick. 
*

title: As a User I want to be able to start a draft load test
custom_steps:
Using the draft picker tool as a base, I want a separate spring boot application which can be started up and will connect to the rule 4 draft (vertx) to listen for events.

@brianmentz
zip file containing everything you need to test this (as well as the other draft load test stories) can be found at: https://ftp.lbisoft.com/public/file/PfocMkzfH0SzrTkJDvv7Nw/draft-load-test.zip

The password to access the file is mlbdraft

This will only be available until 8/10/2018, after which the file will no longer be accessible
once you have the zip file extracted locally, you can run any of the startup-.bat (windows) of startup-.sh (non windows) to kick off the process. To end the process you can close the window that opens or run the 'shutdown.*' script

custom_steps:
The draft load test should take in an excel file with the columns listed below.  For each row in the sheet, it should create <client count> connections to the draft.
Org, User name, password, client count

title: As a BOC DAPM User, I want to see a widget that displays players that have been updated in DPL after being marked Eligible in ebis

Wire: [https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=dpl_updated_eligible_players|https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=dpl_updated_eligible_players]

AC:

* There will be a new DPL Updated Eligible Players on the Admin tab of the Rule 4 dashboard in ebis
* The widget will appear below the Domestic Amateur Players widget
* The widget will be populated with player who have an Draft Status of Eligible and have been updated in DPL since being marked Eligible
* Widget export should work and match the layout of the widget
* Move Top 300 widget to bottom of tab
* If player updated by multiple users types, show prospect

title: As a DAPM Admin User, I do not want Eligibility on Dom Ama profiles reset when updates are made in DPL
custom_steps:
Business Value:
Currently, if updates are made to a player in DPL after the player is marked eligible in ebis, the following fields are reset when the updates are sent to ebis:
  -- Eligibility Status (set back to Pending Eligible)
  -- 21+ Eligible
  -- Not Subject to Deadline
This was originally implemented to ensure updated players got a 2nd eligibility check.  In practice, it was the BOC making most of these changes and it created extra work for them.

AC:
 - If updates are made to a player in DPL after the player is marked eligible in ebis, the following fields will not be reset/updated when the updates are sent to ebis:
  -- Eligibility Status (set back to Pending Eligible)
  -- 21+ Eligible
  -- Not Subject to Deadline

title: Fix Draft Logo
As a user I don't want any of the R4 draft screens to reload when the draft disconnects and reconnects
custom_steps:
When we moved to GCP, we were forced to put in a max connection time.  As a result of this, when that time passes, the draft connection is severed.  We currently have that set to an hour, but thats definitely going to happen and possibly happen frequently.

Instead of fully refreshing the page when the reconnect occurs, it should instead fetch the draft state silently and update with anything which was missed.
AC:
* When the draft disconncects the reconnecting message appears
* Once the draft reconnects the screen is updated with any chagnes which were missed, but does not fully refresh.  It should appear seamless.

title: As a R4 Draft Admin, I want to allow Clubs to draft players as a TWP
custom_steps:
AC:

* The position drop down on the R4 draft day screen will include TWP as an option
* This position will be available to both Clubs and BOC Users
* Choosing TWP will function like any other position change would (i.e. the new position will be displayed on draft related widgets, reports, and be included in the R4 api to clubs and mlb.com)
* Player Profiles will not be updated to display TWP and that position will not be displayed on draft contracts (as typical position changes would)
* If a player is drafted as TWP, this info will be sent to the Commissioners screen
** a two-way player will be displayed for the player
